Package eu.mihosoft.freerouting.geometry.planar

Class PolygonShape

java.lang.Object
eu.mihosoft.freerouting.geometry.planar.PolylineShape
eu.mihosoft.freerouting.geometry.planar.PolygonShape
All Implemented Interfaces:
Area, Shape, Serializable
public class PolygonShape extends PolylineShape
Shape described bei a closed polygon of corner points. The corners are ordered in counterclock sense around the border of the shape. The corners are normalysed, so that the corner with the lowest y-value comes first. In case of equal y-value the corner with the lowest x-value comes first.
See Also:

  • Method Details

    • corner

      public Point corner(int p_no)
      Description copied from class: PolylineShape
      Returns the p_no-th corner of this shape for p_no between 0 and border_line_count() - 1. The corners are sorted starting with the smallest y-coordinate in counterclock sense arount the shape. If there are several corners with the smallest y-coordinate, the corner with the smallest x-coordinate comes first. Consecutive corners may be equal.
      Specified by:
      corner in class PolylineShape

    • cutout

      public Polyline[] cutout(Polyline p_polyline)
      Description copied from interface: Shape
      Cuts out the parts of p_polyline in the interiour of this shape and returns a list of the remaining pieces of p_polyline. Pieces completely contained in the border of this shape are not returned.

    • enlarge

      public PolygonShape enlarge(double p_offset)
      Description copied from interface: Shape
      Returns the offset shape of this shape by offseting the boundary by p_distance to the outside. The result instsnce may be of a different class than this instance. (For example an enlarged IntBox is an IntOctagon).

      public boolean contains(FloatPoint p_point)
      Description copied from interface: Area

    • split_to_convex

      public TileShape[] split_to_convex()
      Splits this polygon shape into convex pieces. The result is not exact, because rounded intersections of lines are used in the result pieces. It can be made exact, if Polylines are returned instead of Polygons, so that no intersection points are needed in the result.
